comment.narrative: 1. Required: Design and implement a training course on social protection in Luanda with a view to strengthening the capacity of researchers, experts and practitioners in the areas of social protection, contributing to the evidence-base policy making. 2. Required: Assess during the training potential areas in which further training may be required.

- Implementation of the M&E training programme for social protection policies that qualify public managers, with basic concepts in a four-hour course - Implementation of the social protection policy M&E training programme that qualifies public managers, with applied practice in a 16-hour course - Compilation of feedback by public managers to improve the M&E proposal of MAS - Elaboration of a final activity report - Preparation of an agenda for activities, with support from UNICEF Angola, and technical meetings with Angola government bodies - Organisation of technical meetings with UNICEF managers to understand and analyse the MAS programme, perform operational prognoses and provide suggestions for improvement vis-à-vis the implementation design - Organisation of technical meetings with public managers of the National Bureaucracy to understand and analyse existing M&E practices, operating prognoses and suggestions for improvement vis-à-vis the MAS implementation design - Organisation of technical meetings with public managers of the Provincial Bureaucracy (Uíge, Moxico, Bié) for the understanding and analysis of existing M&E practices, operating prognoses and suggestions for improvement vis-à-vis the MAS implementation design - Organisation of technical meetings with public managers of the Municipal Bureaucracy to understand and analyse existing M&E practices, operating prognoses and suggestions for improvement vis-à-vis the MAS implementation design - On-site visit to the Municipal CAS to observe its services flowchart vis-à-vis resources available for management, performing an operation prognosis and providing suggestions for improvement ƒƒ Compilation of information collected about state-of-the-art M&E practices in social protection in the MAS pilot - Preparation of recommendations for improved process flows and systematics, as well as a comparison of resources made available to MAS vis-à-vis the pilot’s intended and achieved results - Proposition of M&E instruments and tools, as well as variables/indicators and data collection/organisation routines, based on the flows, systematic and procedural dynamics identified, achieved and improved upon under the scope of the pilot - Preparation of a final report with recommendations in M&E for the Government of Angola, based on previous activities - Organisation of technical meetings with UNICEF managers to present the initial draft version of the final report - Organisation of a final workshop with managers from all agencies involved in the programme, to present and disseminate the final report

1. Provision of training for technicians of the Government of Angola in the M&E of social protection policies, adapted to the needs of the APROSOC project, in particular the decentralisation of the social services component (Municipalização da Acção Social—MAS)
2. Provision of in-country specialised consultancy to support the establishment of the MAS Baseline (defined as: non-randomised, socio-economic and territorial diagnosis of the main aspects related to MAS, based on indicators of input, process and results of preselected interest, focused on initiatives, services, and target groups of policies related to the programme) and M&E tools and methodology aligned with MAS
